m2mimud.state
Class PlayerCharacter

java.lang.Object
  m2mimud.state.PlayerCharacter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class PlayerCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

The PlayerCharacter class is the objeect representation of the player's character, or toon. This is the character with whom they play the game.

See Also:

public static PlayerCharacter createNewCharacter(PlayerCreationCommand comm,
                                                 Game handle)
Creates a new character.

Parameters:
comm - The PlayerCreationCommand that contains information (gender, name, and class) of the new player.
handle - The handle associated with the Game unit that controls the player

copyData

public void copyData(PlayerCharacter other)
This updates this player with the other, but it will only do so is the players have the same Id. Also, the information about the the player's target is no copied. That must be done manually

Parameters:
other - The player to copy

equipItem

public void equipItem(java.lang.String id,
                      int slot)
Equips the item into the given slot If the item is going into any of the hand slots (right, left, or two hand), then the items in the other hand slot are adjust accordingly. If the item is a weapn for the left or right hand, then the two handed slot is emptied and vice versa

Parameters:
id - The id of the item to equip
slot - The slot to use

enterHouse

public void enterHouse(edu.rit.m2mi.Eoid theHouse)
Causes a user to enter a house. Unlike a room, the user maintains no information about which house he or she is in. That is because the system is capable of looking at the location of the player, and then asking all the houses in that area if the player is in them.

leaveHouse

public void leaveHouse()
Removes a player from the house.

Returns the id of the house that the user is in

loadCharacterDataFromFile

public static PlayerCharacter loadCharacterDataFromFile(Game handle,
                                                        java.lang.String name)
Loads the player character from a file into memory. If the player data doesn't exist, it is set to null to indicate that no character exists

Parameters:
handle - The handle to associate with the player
name - The name of the player
